column4: why on earth would you want to run that command every 15 minutes?
: just to free some memory : )
i know its not a good idea because it create a lock on apt but i want to
if you're talking about keeping RAM open, that's not gonna do anything but take up more RAM every 15 minutes
i know , it will take attention of the CPU but i want to understand all this stuff .I'm a learner not a expert .  : )  Just chill bro , i want to try every thing

apt-get clean just clears the downloaded package files from apt-get, which will save some disk space (not memory), so you really only need to run it maybe once a month, unless you are doing some crazy pacakge installing
